title: The Asset Allocator: A Consequential, New Economic Policy
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description: Central bankers worried about inadequate inflation is new, even though it’s now over a decade old. It’s new because we’ve not yet seen how this will end. This podcast (4:49) argues that it would seem likely that stocks and real estate will continue to climb until some unexpected shift finally occurs. So it is desirable to maintain ample cash reserves, because who knows when the shift will occur. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

itunes:summary:
Central bankers worried about inadequate inflation is new, even though it’s now over a decade old. It’s new because we’ve not yet seen how this will end. This podcast (4:49) argues that it would seem likely that stocks and real estate will continue to climb until some unexpected shift finally occurs. So it is desirable to maintain ample cash reserves, because who knows when the shift will occur.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
